Package Huffman

Class CodeTree

  • java.lang.Object
    • Huffman.CodeTree

  • public final class CodeTree
extends java.lang.Object
    A binary tree that represents a mapping between symbols and binary strings. The data structure is immutable. There are two main uses of a code tree:
    • Read the root field and walk through the tree to extract the desired information.
    • Call getCode() to get the binary code for a particular encodable symbol.

    The path to a leaf node determines the leaf's symbol's code. Starting from the root, going to the left child represents a 0, and going to the right child represents a 1. Constraints:

    • The root must be an internal node, and the tree is finite.
    • No symbol value is found in more than one leaf.
    • Not every possible symbol value needs to be in the tree.

    Illustrated example:

      Huffman codes:
    0: Symbol A
    10: Symbol B
    110: Symbol C
    111: Symbol D
  
  Code tree:
      .
     / \
 *    A   .
       / \
 *      B   .
         / \
 *        C   D
    See Also:
    FrequencyTable, CanonicalCode

      Fields

      InternalNode root
      The root node of this code tree (not null).

      CodeTree​(InternalNode root, int symbolLimit)

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> getCode​(int symbol)
      Returns the Huffman code for the specified symbol, which is a list of 0s and 1s.
      java.lang.String toString​()
      Returns a string representation of this code tree, useful for debugging only, and the format is subject to change.

    • Field Detail

      • root

        public final InternalNode root
        The root node of this code tree (not null).

    • Constructor Detail

      • CodeTree

        public CodeTree​(InternalNode root,
                int symbolLimit)
        Constructs a code tree from the specified tree of nodes and specified symbol limit. Each symbol in the tree must have value strictly less than the symbol limit.
        Parameters:
        root - the root of the tree
        symbolLimit - the symbol limit
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if tree root is null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the symbol limit is less than 2, any symbol in the tree has a value greater or equal to the symbol limit, or a symbol value appears more than once in the tree

    • Method Detail

      • getCode

        public java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> getCode​(int symbol)
        Returns the Huffman code for the specified symbol, which is a list of 0s and 1s.
        Parameters:
        symbol - the symbol to query
        Returns:
        a list of 0s and 1s, of length at least 1
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the symbol is negative, or no Huffman code exists for it (e.g. because it had a zero frequency)

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString​()
        Returns a string representation of this code tree, useful for debugging only, and the format is subject to change.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        a string representation of this code tree
